column4: Hiho. Can anyone tell me how to set Ubuntu to a resolution higher than 1024*768 or a refresh rate above 60Hz?
The screen resolution options only go up that far.
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xfree86 ( or xserver-xorg for Hoary)
you should get asked questions
if you edited the file, you will ahve to do it manually
which is why it isn't recommanded
the command I gave you
if you have hoary, substitute xserver-xorg in the command

ah - you need to ty[pe it in a terminal - as you discovered :)

yes - you need to do /etc/init.d/gdm stop as root (sudo in other words)
that should produce a satisfying blackness for you ;)
